Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

FastAPI Application Configuration

This module configures a FastAPI application with routes, middleware, and event handlers.

Attributes:

origins (List[str]): List of allowed origins for CORS.

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(contact: ContactRequest, db: Session, current_user: User) → Contact¶

Create a new contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactRequest) – The contact data to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

The created contact.

Return type:

Contact

Raises:

HTTPException 400 – If the phone number already exists for the current user.

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session, current_user: User) → Type[Contact]¶

Delete a specific contact for the current user by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

The deleted contact.

Return type:

Contact

Raises:

HTTPException 404 – If the contact is not found.

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session, current_user: User) → Type[Contact]¶

Create a new contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactRequest) – The contact data to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

The created contact.

Return type:

Contact

Raises:

HTTPException 400 – If the phone number already exists for the current user.

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, db: Session, current_user: User) → list[Type[Contact]]¶

Get a list of contacts for the current user with pagination.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(q: str, skip: int, limit: int, db: Session, current_user: User) → list[Type[Contact]]¶

Search for contacts by query string with pagination.

Parameters:

  • q (str) – The search query.

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

A list of contacts matching the query.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.upcoming_birthdays(db: Session, current_user: User) → list[Type[Contact]]¶

Get a list of upcoming birthdays for the current user within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, updated_contact: ContactRequest, db: Session, current_user: User) → Type[Contact]¶

Update a specific contact for the current user by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • updated_contact (ContactRequest) – The updated contact data.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

Contact

Raises:

HTTPException 404 – If the contact is not found.

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Confirm a user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address to confirm.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Create a new user with the provided user data.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The user data to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

Retrieve a user by their email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The user with the specified email address.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.set_new_password(email: str, new_password: str, db: Session)¶

Set a new password for a user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user whose password is to be updated.

  • new_password (str) – The new password.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The user with the updated password.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email: str, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Update the avatar URL for a user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user whose avatar is to be updated.

  • url (str) – The new avatar URL.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The user with the updated avatar URL.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Update the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user whose token is to be updated.

  • token (str | None) – The new refresh token or None.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(contact: ContactRequest, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Create a new contact.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactRequest) – The contact data to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Delete a contact by its ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

The deleted contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a contact by its ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

The retrieved contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 10, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a list of contacts with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(q: str = Query(PydanticUndefined), skip: int = 0, limit: int = 10, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Search contacts by name, last name, or email with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • q (str) – The search query.

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

A list of contacts matching the search query.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.upcoming_birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a list of upcoming birthdays for the current user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, updated_contact: ContactRequest, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Update a contact by its ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • updated_contact (ContactRequest) – The updated contact data.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve the current user’s profile.

Parameters:

current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

The current user’s profile.

Return type:

UserDb

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Update the current user’s avatar.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The uploaded image file.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user profile.

Return type:

UserDb

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Log in a user and generate an access token and a refresh token.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The login credentials.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The access token and refresh token.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Refresh an access token using a refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – The authorization credentials.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The new access token and refresh token.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Sign up a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The user data to sign up.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created user and a success message.

Return type:

dict

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

Authentication service class for handling user authentication and authorization.

Attributes:

pwd_context (CryptContext): The password hashing context. SECRET_KEY (str): The secret key used for token encryption. ALGORITHM (str): The encryption algorithm used for token encoding. oauth2_scheme (OAuth2PasswordBearer): The OAuth2 password bearer scheme. r (redis.Redis): The Redis client for caching user data.

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'bimbimbambam'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Create an access token

Args:

data (dict): The data to include in the token payload. expires_delta (float, optional): The token expiration time in seconds

Returns:

str: The encoded access token.

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

Create an email verification token

Args:

data (dict): The data to include in the token payload

Returns:

str: The encoded email verification token.

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Create a refresh token

Args:

data (dict): The data to include in the token payload. expires_delta (float, optional): The token expiration time in seconds

Returns:

str: The encoded refresh token.

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

Decode and validate a refresh token

Args:

refresh_token (str): The refresh token to decode

Returns:

str: The email associated with the token

Raises:

HTTPException: If the token is invalid or has an invalid scope.

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Get the current user based on the access token

Args:

token (str): The access token to decode. db (Session): The database session

Returns:

User: The current user

Raises:

HTTPException: If the token is invalid or the user cannot be found.

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

Get the email associated with an email verification token

Args:

token (str): The email verification token to decode

Returns:

str: The email address

Raises:

HTTPException: If the token is invalid.

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

Generate a password hash for a given plaintext password

Args:

password (str): The plaintext password

Returns:

str: The hashed password.

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verify a plaintext password against a hashed password

Args:

plain_password (str): The plaintext password. hashed_password (str): The hashed password

Returns:

bool: True if the passwords match, False otherwise.

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_confirm_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Send a confirmation email for email verification.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The recipient’s email address.

  • username (str) – The recipient’s username.

  • host (str) – The host URL for generating email confirmation links.

async src.services.email.send_reset_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Send a password reset email.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The recipient’s email address.

  • username (str) – The recipient’s username.

  • host (str) – The host URL for generating password reset links.
